column4: Hey guys.. I have a noob question you get ALL the time: How do I install java.
Ive looked at the guide but it cannot find the package
well it is asked alot
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Java
i understand the repositories, have added them still no luck
uh oh
lol
tarball
Method 1: Use Sun Java packages prebuilt for Ubuntu

It is currently the best way to get an up to date Java installation in Ubuntu. It cares for the environment setup and the Firefox/Mozilla browser plugin as well. For easy installation there is a repository.
so which repository
lol
yeah i hvae done tarball installations before
ive been at this for a month continuously now
have on and off for a year
i got it
on hte wiki
on the wiki it gave me the repository that has the sun pkg
i have been there
ye3ah so im installing it and ill see if it works
thanks anyway ebone and whoever gave me the wiki length
link
no problem.  Personally I use method 6 on that wiki page (for the IBM Java)
